[b][color=white]Maintenance and Downtime[/color][/b]
On September 18th, HackForums experienced a 14 hour downtime. The cause of this downtime was a memory issue. This caused the servers to collapse and did not give [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] any triggers that the site was offline. He quickly went to work and fixed the issue. You can read more about what happened [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4452423]here[/url]. On September 28th, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] did some maintenance that caused outages for a couple of hours. This maintenance was for updates on the site and security upgrades. You can read more about it [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4467010] here[/url]. 

[b][color=white]HackerCraft to Make a Return?[/color][/b]
On September 28th, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] made a feedback [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4466266]thread[/url] for the possible return of HackerCraft. Of the 244 members who voted on the poll, 84% voted for the return of the server. HackerCraft was the official HackForums server run by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]. The server was taken down after about a year and a half of being up. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has also stated that it would be a couple of months before he decides to bring the server back. You can read his thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4466266]here[/url].

[b][color=white]48,000 Accounts Closed[/color][/b]
On September 30th, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] closed about 48,000 accounts. Of this 48,000, 47,000 were regular members, 1,000 were L33t members, and 150 Ub3r members. All of these accounts were closed to prevent the accounts being sold or stolen. The last time [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] bulk closed accounts was about two years ago. Some changes to the rules also came with this mass closure, to better clarify closed accounts because of inactivity. Upgraded members can get their accounts reopened if they provide proof they own the account. You can read more about the account closures [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4469600]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Zero for sale![/color][/b]
Zero, has been put up on the market for sale on Monday September 20th, 2014 by group owner [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1763815]syrah[/url]. The official thread, located [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4454771]here[/url], states the price is $9,000 USD via Bitcoins, Western Union or cash in person in the following cities: New York City, Los Angeles, Austin, and Boston. If you're interested send [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1763815]syrah[/url] a private message to proceed but don't forget to get approval from [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]. 

[b][color=white]The New Era of HF Groups![/color][/b]
This month has been pretty bountiful in past few weeks to the HF groups community, with the changing of the seasons many HF legacy groups have now retired from their days on HF. Through the last month three new groups have been established, they are as follows: Revolution, Specialists, and Titans. Each of these new groups has brought in a new wind of chances in improving the overall experience of HF, we wish these new groups and it's members the best so that they may strive to be an example for bettering the community at large.

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895]Avery[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 208th edition of the HF News, today we're here with Avert. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] Thank you for the great opportunity! I'd like to give a big shoutout to the homies on the playstation nation Eric, Cody, Alabama, Devil, Novelette, 630, JeHc.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Wow I feel so special, how did you get to know this infamous group of hoodlums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] Well, it all started when I started playing the Playstation; I needed something different other then the usual Xbox, so I decided to play with some members on the forum; one member usually led to another member and so on. Now it's usually a daily thing to hop on some Call of Duty Black Ops 2 and play some search and destroy with these members. It's always a great time.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Nice, what made you choose PS3 over Xbox 360? Or PS4 over Xbox One?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] I just wanted a change, I still love my Xbox 360 very much. I will be getting both the Xbox One and PS4 as well just because I just love gaming in general. Both have very great exclusive titles like Halo, and Killzone.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I wish I didn't have 15 console bans from Xbox, I miss my Halo days. Are there any games you are looking forward to coming out soon?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] Yes, I am very much looking forward to Destiny, Far Cry 4, Bloodborne, Call of Duty Advanced Warfare, and of course The Master Chief Collection.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Nice I'm looking forward to Advanced Warfare as well. I've gamed with you for a little bit so I have to ask, what makes you choose BO2 over Ghosts?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] Ghosts isn't really that great, I was hoping for a greater game relatively close to COD4, but found out later upon it's release that it just wasn't my game it played too slow and just bored me.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So what do you do outside of the forums? School, work, fun hobbies?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] I usually work part time at a local bar to support my family, I plan on going to college in 2015 so it's better to have some money then no money at all. I also like to hang out with my friends every week just to stay in touch.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] What do you want to go to college for?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] I plan on working with computers, I very much enjoy using my computer daily so I figured I should give it a go and try to learn more about the way everything works.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well that's a good market to get into, I wish you luck with it. So how do you feel about the integration of OMC?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] To tell you the truth I was wasn't very much into cryptocurrency in the beginning. However, I thought it was a great idea to use the OMC when you purchase 3p1c; I hope to see more about OMC in the future.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So how did you find Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] I found HackForums primarily through my friends telling me about the Gamertag marketplace, Xbox Gaming section, and last but not least The Lounge.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] How would you rate your overall Hack Forums experience?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] I would rate my experience a 9/10; I love the forums very much, although I have very little posts, I still make them count. I primarily browse through the marketplace sections and gaming sections.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] If you could change one thing on site what would it be?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] I really wouldn't change very much, I feel comfortable saying that everything is put together very nicely. If I had to choose one thing however, I would implement a section just for Destiny.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well I think that's all the time we have for this interview, are there any final remarks you'd like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1739895][color=white][b]Averу:[/b][/color][/url] I'd just like to say to any members reading this; you're all great people and I'm glad you contribute to this great forum and make it the awesome forum it is to this day.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759]Fortis[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 208th edition of the HF News, today we're here with Fortis. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] To the people who've been the tightest with me so far; 630, Japanese and SWS.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I picked you because I don't feel that l33t members get their fair representation in the interviews. What's it like being l33t on HF? Is there anything you wish you had perk or permission wise?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] Just like regular members are looked at to upgraded members, We are looked at like a lesser by most Ub3rs since they've been accepted and upgraded a second time. The perks that come with upgrading such as reputation, are fair to a certain degree. The neutral reputation allows L33T's like myself to post our opinion on someone's account, yet it doesn't make a real affect in comparison to a negative reputation that is more noticed and more proficiently used in such things as a Scam Report. Users here are typically judged here on a basis three things; Reputation points, Upgrade status and to most people, awards. I do enjoy the upgraded side of HF but we are basically the middle class and are usually looked at in a different light; just like regular members which we all once were.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I get what you're saying, so what would you change about it to level the playing field between the ranks or is this even possible?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] It's possible to make it a little more fair but it will never be equal I believe the -1 could be beneficial towards L33T's but it's implementation is doubtful. I would add it if I had the choice to make the reputation system a little less unbalanced.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So how did you find Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] I was in an Xbox Live Party with Starborn when he kept mentioning "HF", so I asked him about it and I joined. I really became addicted pretty quickly, learning how to dox and gain access into accounts over networks, I was quickly attached to the black hat world. Seeing the white hat side and deciding the leave the illegal methods behind saved me in the long run. Not to mention since joining HF, I've never felt more accepted than any other place on the internet.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So what kind of stuff do you do outside the forums? Any fun hobbies?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] I am a certified master plumber at the young age of 20, so I work a lot. I am also a certified commercial/residental mover, so when I'm not at work I like to plug my skullcandies into my phone and draw. I tend to sketch for hours on end, music and art are my passions besides linguistics. I'm currently trying to apply for a college here in Florida to study linguistics for a profession so I don't have to work with my hands for the rest of my life.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So what made you like drawing so much? What are some of your best works?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] My father is a very talented artist, so its in my genes. I write and draw in s very unorthadoz way. I hold the pen/pencil between my pinky and ring finger, hold the end with my thumb. I use my writers palm and wrist to contour quick strokes. Art has been my haven since I was but a little 'Ol jitterbug. Some of my artwork can be seen here: http://m.imgur.com/a/H8TzK

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Pretty good stuff. So I know you recently took a break from Hack Forums, why was that?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] I am currently on federal probation from an issue that goes back to when I was a kid and before hackforums existed. I had received classified files over YIM, unacknowledged to me that they were that kind of file. I boxed my computer up and around 6:30AM my door was kicked in. I was charged with Receiving Classified files with the intent to redistribute, sentanced to 421 days in a Federal Youth Camp and probation until 2016. My break recently was involving my public defender is helping me get off early. A chapter in my life I cannot wait to close.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Wow that's some heavy shit. So do you have any Hack Forums goals?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] I'd like to get ub3r, I'd one day like to be apart of the mentors as I have a high respect for them. I'd also like to earn a few of those shiny awards, do at least $1,000 of giveaways thru out my career here and get 20k or so posts. I really just want to stay apart of the community for the years to follow.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Hot damn those are some big goals. So how do you feel about the Omnicoin craze? Have you looked into it much?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] I'm trying to learn about it, I've been using Abe Lincoln's Online OMC Wallet, it's still in beta so it's still being fixed up. I can't use OMC to it's full potential as a mobile user. Since I use HF on my phone 24/7, the amount of things offered among HF I cannot participate in sadly.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Hold up, did I hear that right? Are you strictly a mobile user? How do you deal with that?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] Yes you did :). I use a basic Android ZTE phone and actually, I'm quite content being a mobile user as it has some advantages in my eyes; one being that I can go literally anywhere with it. Once my probation ends I'll be able to get my laptop fixed and legally use it. Another is Google's Text-to-speech when I'm being a loaf. For now tho, I'm happy with being a mobile user.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I use mobile as well, but I use my laptop a lot more. The struggle is definitely real. Would you ever want a mobile Hack Forums? I've seen some forums with mobile versions, but I'm not a fan of them, what's your take on this?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] I am against a mobile version HackForums, I browse the forums just like I would on a desktop or laptop, I just use my fingers. I'm too familiarized with where the buttons are and I wouldn't want to adjust. If there was a mobile HF, I would just browse in Desktop View.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So what changes would you make to the site if you could?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url]  Honestly, I like the way hackforums is overall, the only things I would change are the previously mentioned L33T abilities, I would also like to see the staff be able to get involved in deal disputes is the proof is sufficient and clearly evident. I see too many scam reports unresolved nowadays, I see a scam report every other refresh of the New Posts. I would also like to see more users being more helpful towards those with questions, regardless of user group, userbar or post count.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well I think that's all the time we have for this interview. Are there any concluding remarks you'd like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=965759][color=white][b]Fortis:[/b][/color][/url] I would like to thank you for your time and thanks to the HF New Team for all they report here on HF and the dedication they have. Thanks for choosing me, I feel pretty honored. Thanks for reading everyone! Deuces.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Hey, Factor8! Welcome to this weeks edition of the news. Anything you'd like to say before we begin?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b][/color] Hey Clique, thanks for the opportunity. I’d like to give a big shout-out to some people who I've known on HF for a long time, notably Rusty_V, Tɦɛ Gʀiɱ, T3h Hack3r, Xch4ng3, Paradoxum, Saged, Cobija.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Just curious, but how'd you get your staff position on Hackforums? Any story behind it?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b][/color] I remember I was appointed Staff in July 10. To be honest, I was also shocked when I read Omni's invitation PM because I never had an inclination or ambition to be a moderator when I joined HF. That time we had like more than 10 staff members. Someone told me it took them like around a month to decide about me over others in a nomination thread. As usual, it's always Omni's call on picking up new staff after taking feedback from existing one's. I Never Dreamed It Would Turn Out This Way. LOL.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] What else do you do online?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b][/color]  Apart from my Admin duties on HF and browsing HF, I like playing some online games and watching Netflix, YT. And of course chat with a select Troll on HF also. I'm an avid reader also so read lots of stuff and resources.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Are you more of a Playstation or Xbox kind of dude?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b][/color]  PlayStation till I live and play. :)

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] If you never got this admin opportunity, would you still be on the forums?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b][/color]  LOL. That's a funny question. Had I not been Admin, I would still be a moderator right? Jokes apart, I'm on HF because I enjoy here. The day I feel I'm not enjoying or doing what I do, I would quit. It's not about being a moderator /Admin really. But yeah, I've moderated for like almost four and half years so would feel lost out of place If I was not Admin tomorrow. Just become so used to moderating that sometimes I feel what would I do if my tools don't exist anymore.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Any tips for anyone looking to get more info about your line of work?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b][/color] I'm self employed IRL. Trade in garments & ferrous/non ferrous scrap. Just don't have the inclination to work under anybody. Better to work for yourself.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Are you a member of any other forums or communities?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b][/color]   Not at all. HF is enough for me. I live here. :)

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  What's the deal with your name? Why'd you choose it?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php=action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b] Nothing specific for my handle. Just found it unique.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Any advice or insight for anyone who wants to join the staff team or mentors?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php=action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b] Don't be a try hard. Don't be an ass kisser. Don't show off your E-penis. Just be yourself and enjoy the community. Read rules, respect rules and don't strive to become a moderator out here. Because the wannabe's never get it. The people who get it are the one's who never worked for it.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Anything else you'd like to say before we wrap this up?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php=action=profile&uid=103669]Factor8™[/url]:[/b] [video=youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FTLwiccIOxI[/video]
[/spoiler]

[color=white][b]Omnicoinj Nearing Completion[/b][/color]
Thanks to the hard work of [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2015410]ӍeshCollider[/url][/b], Omnicoinj is nearing completion. This will allow Android developers, and general Java coders to create fully featured Omnicoin-centric apps. So if you're a Java developer, keep your eyes open for the completed product. 

[color=white][b]Omnicoin Project Restructuring[/b][/color]
In hopes to revitalize work on Omnicoin, the entire project team has been redone, removing the inactive members, and adding both [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1256441][color=#00A0F0]Abraham Lincoln[/color][/url][/b] and [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2015410]ӍeshCollider[/url][/b] to the team. In the short time since this restructuring, the team has already created some patches that will help the Omnicoin code function properly, and turned to the community for information on where they'd like to see the coin go. This should help rejuvenate the value, and encourage more use.

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=255459]Delirium™[/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1173142]Goodies[/url], & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=600771]Vinnie[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]The "Fappening"[/color][/b]
Over the preceding weeks, various celebrities have had lewd pictures and videos of them leaked by anonymous hackers and posted on various websites such as 4chan and #. The most likely way that this was achieved was by guessing the answers to security questions or the passwords themselves. Another possibly method is by using the Find My iPhone bug to brute force an Apple ID password without locking the account. The source code for this tool named iBrute may be found [url=https://github.com/hackappcom/ibrute]here[/url]. Many people are taking this as an extreme violation of the celebrities' privacy, but the hackers that leaked them seem to believe that this falls under the umbrella of free speech. Apple(tm) has been taking many security measures to ensure that this kind of thing does not happen again and have patched the known Find My iPhone bug, but they assure us that neither iCloud nor Find My iPhone is responsible for the leak.

[b][color=white]Google Chrome Insecure Extension[/color][/b]
Chrome extensions have become a rather useful way for malicious users to socially engineer unsuspecting users into downloading malware. Links claimed to have videos or articles of generally interesting nature lead to a seemingly innocent Adobe Flash Player Chrome Extension from the Chrome Store which, when downloaded, creates backdoors in the "browser extension components" folder within the browser's installation directory. With this, the malware distributor is able to bypass all Chrome security measures and convert CRX (Chrome extension file) to EXE (Windows DOS Executable) files. Until a new patch is released, or some security measures are updated, refrain from downloading any non-explicitly trusted Chrome extensions.

[b][color=white]Firefox Adds Major Security[/color][/b]
Any novice hacker familiar with network attack and defense should know that instead of attacking the encryption algorithm of secure information, the best way to intercept it is to create a rogue SSL certificate and forge an encrypted tunnel with your victim and their target. This way, you can intercept data that is encrypted with your own algorithm and are able to decrypt it with ease. However, this requires the browser to be able to accept rogue certificates. Firefox has made several advancements in its security of Firefox 32. They have introduced PKP (Public Key Pinning) which will aid in the protection of unwanted MitM (Man in the Middle) attacks by keeping track of certificates and certificate authorities and verifying their destination. They are also making improvements to the HTTP cache and the Android versions of Firefox. This added security makes them arguably the most secure web browser on the market today!

[b][color=white]PhpMyAdmin 4.2.8 Brings Minor Bug Fixes[/color][/b]
PhpMyAdmin, the famous tool to manage MySQL database, which is written in PHP, has finally reached version 4.2.8. The new PMA version is available and contains lot of fixes revolving around its security, therefore, do not expect any big feature changes. According to PMA's changelog, a weird behavior (which prevented sql.js from being read) while exporting and a case where "CREATE TABLE AUTO_INCREMENT" would be ignored have been fixed. You can find the latest PhpMyAdmin version [url=http://linux.softpedia.com/get/Database/Administrative-frontents/phpMyAdmin-77.shtml]here[/url].

[b][color=white]New Youtube Scam: E-mail From A Youtube Representative Warns About Your Account's Closure[/color][/b]
A new Youtube scam has risen where a number of Youtube account holders would receive an e-mail by a so-called "Youtube Representative" informing them about their account's imminent closure. As it's has been reported by various users on Instagram and Google Group, the e-mail has a link which leads to a fake online research and the user is asked to enter various sensitive information to confirm he/she is not a bot. In some cases, the user's phone number is required and it's being speculated that phone numbers are being used in smishing (sms phishing). Christopher Boyd of MalwareBytes noted that the best way to ensure your Youtube account's safety is to contact Youtube directly.

[b][color=white]Windows XP Users Still Safe[/color][/b]
After Microsoft discontinued its support and updates for Windows XP and warned XP users that they might be vulnerable to new threats found, a research from the antivirus institute "AV-TEST" indicates that Windows XP users are still safe. According to the research, a PC running Windows XP can still be safe as long as the latest updates are installed on the system. However, the institute clarified that a not up-to-date machine can be still compromised. Microsoft on the other side, insists that Windows XP users must update to a newer Windows version (which still has updated released) and, while AV-TEST researchers agree with the aforementioned claim, they still believe that an infected Windows XP machine can be cleaned with the necessary tools and actions. 

[color=white][b]Fake Flappy bird Application[/b][/color]
Recently there was an extreme digital exposure of private and very person nude images of hundreds of female celebrities such as Jenny McCarthy, Kristin Dunst, Kate Upton and many more. These leaks were posted on a very notorious bulletin bored called 4Chan. This lead to another image board called AnonIP that shows a group of hackers who have used a cloned version of Flappy Bird, the application to steal and collect the nude images of other females from their Android devices, these images were automatically sent to their remote servers and later leaked.

[color=white][b]Apple Adds Security Alerts To iCloud[/b][/color]
In the wake of one of the biggest digital exposures of private nude selfies of dozens of high profile celebrities Apple has said as a company that they have plans to add extra security measures to keep [i]hackers[/i] out of users accounts. One of the latest features they have added is when someone tries access your account, Apple will notify the user that their email or password is being changed from another IP address, even though this is a new feature for Apple other companies such as Google have already had this implemented for some time now. They have also added an extended two factor authentication for users who have 2FA implemented.

[color=white][b]Windows Malware To Mac[/b][/color]
Till this day we've seen dozens of different malware targeting the Windows operating system but not the Macintosh thanks to Apple in regards to the way it safeguards it's devices security but with time some cyber criminals and malware authors have found ways to exploit the Mackintosh as well. Security researches have unmasked a group of cyber criminals that have recently started using a variant XSLC backdoor programs to target the Mac OSX operating system. This Mac version of backdoor shares a large portion of it's code with the Windows version which is sort of the same backdoor that has been around from around 2009. According to FireEye researches, the group dubbed as GREF is already infamous for their previous cyber criminal activities which lead to attacks again the US defence Industrial Base.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=649674]Eternal.[/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1079277]Harlem[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1698590]Abide[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left] 

[b][color=white]The iPhone 6 Was Released[/color][/b]
The long awaited iPhone 6 has been released this week following the released of iOS 8. The iPhone 6 comes in 2 different versions, the iPhone 6 and the iPhone 6 Plus. The design has improved from previous iPhones, the iPhone 6 is 6.9 mm thick, has a 4.7 inch screen with a 1334 x 750 resolution and 326ppi which is the same as the iPhone 5s. The iPhone Plus is 7.1mm thick, sports a 5.5 inch screen size and has a 401ppi display at full HD resolution of 1920 x 1080. The iPhone 6 only comes with 1GB of Ram, 8MP back facing camera which can shoot 1080P resolution full HD videos. Apple says it will be faster and better than previous models, and the camera has undergone some upgrades as well that add in features such as burst shot, time lapse mode and continuous autofocus.

[b][color=white]Netflix Urged By Copyright Holders To Ban VPN Use[/color][/b]
Copyright holders feel they are being swindled for licensing fees by Netflix users who use a VPN to access other countries versions for better shows. Local startups in Australia are especially upset because they are being overlooked due to the volume of VPN users who get what the want through Netflix even though they technically shouldn't. Over 200,000 Australians are using a VPN service to access the United States version of Netflix, bypassing Australia's version altogether. Lobbyists are saying the want a global ban on VPN use with Netflix services. Hulu banned VPN use globally in April of 2014 but Netflix would effect many more users based on the audience Netflix draws.

[b][color=white]FCC Requires 10Mbps To Be Considered Broadband[/color][/b]
The FCC Chairman Tom Wheeler told major phone and internet giants AT&T and Verizon that they did not offer high enough speeds to be considered broadband in many areas. He stated that you must offer at least 10Mbps to be considered broadband, and to be considered for government subsidies to help expand mobile and internet services. This change effects mainly rural areas that were funded by the Government to reach. This has been one of many recent strikes against the internet giants by the FCC for giving service that is below what standards should have been.[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1093501]Roger Waters[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Anima.[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Metal Gear Franchise Comes to Mac for the First Time[/color][/b]
The popular franchise, Metal Gear, has recently released the first game in their Metal Gear series to be playable on the Mac. Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance is out now in the steam store, where players can purchase the game fr $25.49 instead of $30 due to a 15-percent discount until September 30th. Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance not being completely new, the game was released to the Xbox 360, PS3, and PC back in 2013. Metal Gear is long due for the mac, it seems. If you're not interested in Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance, be prepared for new games in the series. Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes and Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain will be coming to the PC soon enough. No dates have been announced, but expect to see Ground Zeroes before The Phantom Pain.

[b][color=white]Destiny Updates[/color][/b]
Bungie has stated that they're going to be updating and patching a lot of areas within the game. First, "Treasure Cave" has taken its toll. Developers said "Spawn timers for the waves of enemies could be farmed for easy loot." The timer has changed from 6 seconds, to 40. Players should be expecting "cave farming" to be less efficient. Next, the Destiny developers have been looking at the weapons. Don't worry about that. Concerned about how overpowered the weapons may or may not be, some of the guns have been tweaked in a patch. The patch will be making the Auto rifles more stable and not too overpowered due to it's range. Used for medium to short range, players were able to effectively kill their target from long range. Too much of a long range, developers said. In addition, Scout Rifles will be getting a fix too. Receiving a buff from the patch, the Scout Rifles will due more damage and be more useful than it is now in its current state. Last for the gun updates, expect Shotguns to have reduced range. Finally, the player classes will be getting a few tweaks as well. Bungie wants to create a more balanced player class. Not much more has been released due to class tweaks and updates.

[b][color=white]WoW Cool Update, Bro![/color][/b]
Ever done something where you accidentally stayed signed into someone's computer? Ever been hacked? Well, if you have a WoW account you can feel safe when it comes to someone having access to your account. As always, be safe, play safe, and of course have fun. A lot of players in the gaming community spend hours leveling their characters and grinding in PVP to get cool items and gear. Sadly enough, some users get in sticky situations where someone may possibly have access to their account and said user may get their characters deleted as payback, for fun, or just to ruin that persons life. Blizzard, makers of World of Warcraft, are going to be adding a feature which will let players recover, or "undelete" the characters, as Blizzard calls it. Said announcement of the "undelete" feature was shared on the World of Warcraft blog, which states that it will be added to the patch prior to Warlords of Draenor release. WoW fans should expect to be purchasing Warlords of Draenor on November 13th so players should not be relying on this feature just yet. Not all characters will be recoverable. If your character is greater than level 10 or above 55 (for Death Knights), your character will be eligible for recovery. Furthermore, there is a little more to that too. When it comes to deleting your character, if you're over level 50, then you can "undelete" your character at any given time. If you're less than 50, then you will have 120 or 90 days depending on your level. You will have access to the "undelete". Don't you fret, all items will be restored with your character.

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1518613]1001[/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1171567]Chieftain[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1371476]Feynman[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]New Giant Dinosaur Species Found[/color][/b]
A new dinosaur species was recently uncovered by a multinational group of paleontologists. [i]Dreadnoughtus schrani[/i] is the largest land animal reported to date, with approximately 25 meters in length and the same height as a two-story building and weighting about 59 tons (which is more than what 7 T. [i]rexes[/i] would weigh). Its fossils were found in southern Patagonia, Argentina. The titanosaur was a herbivorous, meaning it’d eat plants. However, its massive size cleared away its fear for predators, hence the name Dreadnoughtus, meaning “fears nothing”.

[b][color=white]Glimpse at Neutrinos from Sun's Core[/color][/b]
Under a mountain in central Italy resides a 13.7 meter steel shell with more than 2200 light-gathering sensors. The purpose of the experiment, known as the the Borexino experiment and supported by countries like Italy and the United states, is to receive flashes of light from neutrinos, subatomic particles, that were shot out of the sun’s core. The Borexino detector was able to do just that on the 28th of August, with the neutrinos reaching Earth in just eight minutes, nearly at the speed of light. The findings obtained helped to provide insight into solar energy, and, indirectly to the other stars’ energy.

[b][color=white]Electric Shock to Brain Boosts Memory[/color][/b]
Researchers have found that applying electric shocks to the brain can aid in memory improvement. They claim that the discovery opens up possibilities for the treatment of strokes and early-stage Alzheimer’s and can even change the normal effects of brain aging. To deliver the electrical current to the brain, they used a non-invasive technique known as Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation. The study also demonstrated that remembering requires several brain regions to work with a key memory structure – the hippocampus. Not only does TMS boost our memory for a great duration of time, but it also improves our ability to learn new skills.

[b][color=white]75% of Australia's Living Species Are Unknown[/color][/b]
Jo Harding of Bush Blitz recently told reporters that an estimated 75% of species living in Australia are currently unknown and have yet to be discovered. Bush Blitz, a program supported by federal and state government agencies and research institutions, is responsible for discovering new species throughout Australia, which has led to the discovery of hundreds of new species. So far, about 700 new species have been discovered, and that's only over the last 4 years. Most of these undiscovered species, however, are fungi and other non-mammal life that could prove tough to find.

[b][color=white]Californian Blue Whales Recover From Whaling[/color][/b]
Recent analysis suggests that the number of blue whales living off the coast of California is roughly the same before humans started hunting them to near extinction about 110 years ago. The Los Angeles Times report that there are approximately 2,200 blue whales living off the coast of California and Mexico. While this may seem like a small number compared to the hundreds of thousands living near Antarctica, this is still a great success for conservation of a species. 

[b][color=white]Ozone Pollution In India[/color][/b]
In one year alone, the pollution in India has cost the country over a billion dollars in dead crops, which could have fed nearly 100 million living under the poverty line. The study looked at agricultural effects if 2005 of high concentrations of ground-level ozone, a plant-damaging pollutant formed by emissions from vehicles, cooking stoves and other sources. Delhi, India's capital, has reached levels of pollution comparable to Beijing, one of the world's most polluted cities.  The main component of smog is ozone at ground level, which can cause leaf damage, injuring and killing vegetation. There are currently no quality standards in India to protect agriculture from the effects of pollution.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]
